I'm a big fan of their posole, and their roasted chicken is excellent!  Their soft tacos are good, too, with the best corn tortillas.  Good selections of salsas and beer.  Portions are big, so there's always leftovers.

The only complaint I have is the size, but it can't be helped.  If you plan to eat inside during a busy time (dinner), you feel like a vulture hovering near the tables.  I'm always amazed by people who continue sitting and chatting after they have eaten their meals, especially seeing throngs of people waiting for a table.  It makes me crazy.
author: Casey N.

description:
definitely one of my favorite local spots to grab a cheap dinner. excellent food (burritos, tamales, chips, salsas, chiles).. all excellent. my favorite is the namesake green chile, but the red is also really good. 

$2 pacificos go great with any meal. very friendly service and just an overall cool vibe. this is what all neighborhood cafes should be like.
author: Jon N.

description: Awesome Mexican Food and like Chris, I frequent Papalote. Try the whole chicken, super tasty and the meal will feed you for a few days.
author: Bryan M.

description: Came here for the first time last night with my fiance and our two friends. They just moved around the corner, so we decided to grab a bite from a local grub spot. SO GLAD we came across this place. Very clean inside and the service is incredible. Every employee there had a smile on their face, and were clearly excited to serve you (which is rare nowadays). There was no wait, so we walked right up to the counter and placed our order. I ordered the Stuffed Sopaipillas with Carne Adovada (red chile pork) and a margarita. We didn't have to wait long for our food, and they brought it right to our table- still steaming, which is always a good sign. And normally I don't really care how my food is presented, as long as its good...but, the first thing WE ALL noticed when our plates came was how perfectly placed everything was on the plate, even the refried beans were in a perfect little pile, and not "slopped" all over the place. I was very impressed. And the icing on the cake: it was probably the best Mexican food I've ever had. I usually can't eat much (ie: one taco and a few bites of rice and I'm stuffed), but I cleared my plate and probably could have licked it clean. If you're in the area, I highly recommend this modern, cafe-style Mexican joint. It's small, but there are plenty of places to sit and the service is outstanding. I'm definitely coming back!!
author: Ashlee M.

description: Taste and value. The chickens are roasted with lots of love, this is evident in a simple soft taco that was loaded with juicy white meat. Burrito was top-notch (with green chile on top of course). The rice, beans, are so flavorful, even the tamale was extraordinarily packed with comforting flavors. A great find tucked away in the neighborhood! Go on off-hours to ensure a seat.
author: P C.

description: Very good quality Mexican food (which is apparently hard to find because most places I've visited such).  Had the vegetarian burrito with tofu plate, chips and guacamole, and the blue corn dish with veggies.  Everything was very very good, even though a bit small.  I used a coupon from Green Zebra (which I got at Thom's on Geary for $5 because it is almost expired) and I don't know if it was even applied because my bill came out to be about $30 and the bill does not list the specifics. That was the only negative part of eating here.  Would I go here again?... yes!
author: trang n.

description: This place is great. Burritos are awesome. I like the green sauce but sometimes I get "Christmas". Food is consistent and has never let me down. Highly recommend trying this out.
author: Chris S.

description:
best in town , super good food ,Takes a long time ,the kitchen is messy 
they leave a rag on the food line ,((NOT SO GOOD ) ,, but food is yummy 
 $ 1.00 then it should be , $ 9,50 for a super burrito after tax ,a bit much , 
but again good ,, and they freeeeken close at 930
author: matt p.

description: Green Chile is definitely one of my favorite places to eat, and it doesn't hurt that it's just a few blocks from my apartment. Their quesadillas are fantastic, but my absolute favorite are their breakfast burritos! They are pretty much to die for, and I recommend them to anyone. They are so delicious!
author: Danielle S.

description: I love this healthy, organic Mexican place.  I've never had healthy Mexican before this place.  It can get crowded, so be prepared for take out vs sitting inside.  However, it turns over quickly and the staff is quick to clean after the last party.
author: Chad P.

description: Love it! The blue corn chicken homestyle enchiladas, the niman ranch steak burrito and nachos, the flan, the $2 pacificos, its soooo good! A little pricey, but its so worth it. Still waiting to have the breakfast here...
author: Jenica M.

description: I have a paper to write.  I have for a month now.  I haven't been able to get it done.  But now I'm thinking that if I bring my laptop and get a bowl of green chile stew it all just might come together.
author: Nora B.

description: Delicious San Franciscan-Mexican food. While not an "authentic" burrito, it was still really yummy. What earned them major points in my book is that they use all organic ingredients, free range chicken, and Niman Ranch beef. I had a super burrito with Niman Ranch beef w/ sour cream, guac, and salsa- YUM. The restaurant itself is so cute too! It is clean, cool, and welcoming- it kind of reminds me of a slow, sunny, sunday afternoon lunch type of place.
author: lauren j.

description:
UPDATE: I stumbled in here on a Sunday morning hung-over and purchased a breakfast burrito.  It wasn't the biggest brekkie rito out there, (see El Castillito) but it was damn tasty.  Hot, with gooey cheese, bacon, freshly cooked eggs..none of that microwave BS, and potatoes.  Plus some killer chile -- the life blood of this establishment -- that was mild and still pretty f'ing hot.  I've got a good tolerance for this stuff and it still had heat, so watch out on a touchy and alcohol-abused stomach.  Anyways, BOMB. Go eat one, even if you're not hung over...it's probably still good, I'm not sure, alcohol makes everything better.

My name is Josh, and I am a burrito-a-holic.  (HI JOSH).  When my roommate and her friends told me they were going to a Mexican restaurant and asked if I wanted to come along, I was apprehensive.  I had just gotten back from the gym and wasn't really looking to stuff my belly with burrito lovin'...and I knew, based on my DISEASE, I would do just that if I was taken to a taqueria.  Instead, I was pleasantly surprised by Green Chile Kitchen's fresh, organic and...dare I say, lighter menu?  I got the crispy taco plate with ground beef and made it 'super' for an extra $1 (which added guacamole and sour cream to my tacos).  I was sold on this place the second I bit into the thin crunchy blue-tortilla exterior of my taco and got a mouthful of beef (wait, what?).  Ground beef is usually pretty 'meh', but this ground beef had character.  It was all like...telling my mouth jokes, and whispering sweet nothings into my taste buds.  Add the mouth-watering food to the atmosphere of this place, mellow-laid back-chill-etc, and the $2 pacificos which are proudly advertised as "$2 every day" and all the time, AND the fact that I haven't even TRIED their breakfast burrito or super burrito...basically, I just found a regular spot to add to my rotation.  Go here, grab a bottle of wine, or a pacifico, sit outside (!) on a nice night, or grab a booth with friends, and prepare to have a totally sweet-ass meal.
author: Josh T.

description: It's about time I found a decent breakfast burrito in SF.  For those familiar with Cantina in SB you know what I'm talking about.  Green Chile definitely deserves a solid rating on their BB.  The 5 star review will be reserved for my one and only Cantina.  Sorry, GCK.  And I actually felt good after eating that large breakfast burrito...could it be that they are healthy too?  I'll be back a lot.
author: Piper B.

description: This is what Chipotle aspires to be.  Delicious Mexican comfort food with a gentrified twist.  GCK trumps, chumps.  Used to be that getting taqueria food outside of the Mission was just plain wrong.  No 'mo.  I fed my low-carb gluttony with the naked super Fulton Valley chicken burrito in a bowl sans tortilla and rice, which is an amazing black bean stew with all the fixings.  Outdoor seating on a sunny day couldn't be beat with a slight breeze.
author: Esther R.

description: OK, so my subsequent experiences were MUCH better than my original review. Perhaps they were just having an off day on my first visit, because I went back and both food and service were tremendously improved.
author: Beth T.

description: I was pretty impressed by this place - no, it's not authentic Mexican but it also doesn't claim to be. "Mexican-inspired" is what they purport, I think.  I am the last person who's happy to pay extra $ for organic but I thought the prices were really reasonable and the portions were good.
author: Amina B.

description: My new go-to weekday bfast/dinner spot.  Great chorizo tacos.  They have the second best nachos plate in the city (to Fly Bar).
author: Tim G.

description: Awesome!!! One of my top Mexican joints in San Francisco. The burritos are amazing and smothered in a red or green chili sauce. The guacamole is great and the place has a nice vibe. I recommend lunch as dinner can be a little hectic.
author: John J.

description: My default for lunch. great food. you won't be disappointed. great selection of draft beers. dog friendly seating outside.
author: G. M.

description: There have been enough reviews on this place so this is short. This place is dam good you should try it and love it!
author: Jeff H.

description: I was just amazed by the chicken here. It is incredibly tasty, and the amount of food is humongous for the money. Add to that a very cozy place and two or three beers to chose from, and you have something great.
author: Javi V.

description: Yeah, I was staying at the building adjacent to this place and had to force myself not come in here everyday. The Chorizo Burritos are rediculous. 2$ Pacifico Beer. AND their Breakfast burrito is offered till 12:00 on the weekday.
author: scott g.

description: I was considering giving GCK four stars for diplomacy, but when it comes down to it, this restaurant serves the tastiest burritos I've had in San Francisco. In fact, one of the perks of recently having moved back to Western Addition is being closer to this spot. High quality, mostly sustainable ingredients make not only for great taste but also guilt-free dining and good value. Their posole is delicious, the home-roasted chicken is outstanding, and their breakfast burritos brighten my weekend mornings. Several months ago I noticed a lag in service and that the tables were not being bussed quickly enough; however, that issue seems to have been remedied. As far as inexpensive yet atmospheric neighborhood dining goes, GCK is as good as it gets.
author: Andrew S.

description: I've only been there once, but I'll go back a few more times I'd imagine. I was there with a buddy that lived in Santa Fe, and he agreed that the stew is top notch. We also split a 1/2 roasted chicken with potatoes on the side, but the taters were really uncooked (they're just a side of the same green chili stew potatoes which normally finish cooking in the stew), and we let the staff know. The lady behind the counter was interested in how the food was and took our comments/recommendations with great interest. She then went into this long winded diatribe about her personal business philosophy that made no sense when we thought about it outside, but hey...you gotta have heart to survive in the restaurant beez-neez in this town - that's fer sho. I'm looking forward to trying some Niman Ranch burritos - I love NM shtuff and don't mind the non-gut-bomb-sized burritos they serve here.
author: Justin H.

description: The burritos don't compare to Papalote's (just down the block on Fulton), but everything else is pretty tasty.  All in all, it's a good neighborhood staple with reasonable prices.  I especially recommend the roasted chicken -- it practically falls off the bone.
author: Heather M.

description: Definately a great place for lunch!  I really enjoyed their veggie burrito, and the atmosphere was great.  The veggies were fresh in the burrito and the quantity of food was good.  The service a little slow for lunchtime (thats why the 4 rather than 5 stars).
author: Avinash R.

description: Save your money.   For $9.50 at lunch, all you get is a tasteless five-inch tortilla with a couple tablespoons full of ground beef and bland rice and beans.
author: Alan M.

description: This place seriously knocks my socks WAY off! I had the blue corn veggie enchiladas and my friend had an assortment of different types of veg-friendly soft tacos. I'm pretty sure I forgot to breathe while eating cuz I just couldn't stop putting the deliciousness in my mouth.  The service was fast and the ambiance is warm and comforting.  It's a place you can feel good about eating at too. Although I'm vegetarian, I appreciate the fact that they are using responsibly sourced meat...and they use organic & local ingredients as well. I'm still reminiscing about this meal days later. I'll be back again and again!
author: Alicia O.

description:
the food is really good. since i have been a veggie for the past year this place fits the bill for good vegie alternatives.
but, i can not understand why it is so packed other than lack of competition in the area for mex food. people think they found the end all be all of mexican food but it is just good. now add in the long lines and it moves down a bit on how great it is. but i can walk there so i put up with it which is i guess what everyone else does.
author: Cathy M.

description: Surprisingly good. Not something I would expect from a place I had never heard of, but really enjoyed my enchiladas and my posole. Great flavors and nice spice to everything. Very family friendly, noticed a lot of kids around. $2 Pacificos anyone?
author: Jeannette L.

description: I found the food very tasty.  But when I asked the server for a tortilla on the side he pointed to the cutlery.  Being that he was hispanic and he knew I was hispanic he should have realized how important it is to have a tortilla on the side.  Also, not a single chip was served with my good but overpriced food.
author: CARLOS L.

description:
the food is pretty fantastic here.

i would have to agree that they could advertise things a bit better as far as free internet and menu options....

i would also really like to pull for the breakfast burritto being offered every day of the week....and every hour of the day for that matter. it is quite delicious.

mmmm.
author: sharon t.

description: I don't feel so bad when I indulge in a big fat burrito here, because they feel healthy (or healthier).  The food is really good but i have to diss them a tiny bit for screwing up my order twice.
author: marie m.

description: This is not a taqueria and, as such, should not necessarily be compared to them outright.  The meat is all free range and organic, in addition to local, fresh and organic produce, which contributes to the higher prices...   If you are in the mood for a cheap (and delicious) burrito head to the mission, but if you want some new [mexican] flavors, healthier ingredients and less environmental guilt then give it a try.  $2 Pacificos are hard to beat too...
author: David F.

description: Being a native of Colorado, I'm always looking for green chili that reminds me of home and I was hoping Green Chile would be that place.  Unfortunately my first experience is one to forget.  I ordered a Breakfast burrito with spicy chorizo and hot green chili.  To my astonishment, a breakfast burrito with meat and green chili costs $10!!  That is double of what any breakfast burrito should ever cost but I was determined to get a try of the green chili.  I ordered one to go.  Once I got home and took my first bite I noticed how small the burrito was and there was no meat what so ever!  I paid $10 for a burrito i could have easily made for $2.  The green chili very mild and reminded me of the canned variety you can buy from Safeway.  Did i mention how small it was?  After devouring the burrito, I'm still hungry.  Long story short, if your feeling like a small, $10 breakfast burrito with mediocre green chili this is your spot.  I'll pass next time
author: Teddy M.

description:
I ordered a chicken quesadilla from Green Chile Kitchen. When I got home I had a steak quesadilla. This is not the first time they gave me steak instead of chicken. I don't like steak. That's why I order chicken.

I've also ordered from here a plate that included a salad. As I ordered I was asked what kind of salad dressing I wanted. Then when I got home I had no salad. Or dressing.

I'm tired of not getting what I order here. I've had it. I won't be back.
author: Heather B.

description: This is our local burrito joint, owned by the friend of a friend's family, more's the pity. The food is good, we have eaten here many times. But this is the last time. Tonight we waited over an hour for 4 burritos. Called in a take out order, were told 15 minutes, went in, waited an hour, and finally found the bag of our food waiting, lost and forgotten, on a side table. Had been sitting there a while. Sigh. you lose, green chili kitchen, and so do we.
author: C S.

description: Having spent 10 years in Santa Fe I can say that I know my New Mexican food and this is NOT it! The food was tasteless. The green chile stew was boring.... how is that possible?? For a New Mexico joint it sucks... for a taqueria it is average at best.
author: John S.

description:
I am sad the category of this restaurant is Mexican. This is not Mexican food this is NEW Mexican food which has its own unique culture and cuisine. For those of you who don't know, the state of New Mexico is between Texas and Arizona, below Colorado. This is also just New Mexican inspired food. Real New Mexicans don't charge a freakin' dollar for a sopapilla (they are served with a meal) and they don't ask if they want hot or mild, they just serve you the chile. 
 I am from New Mexico and this place is just OK. They say they have chile from Hatch which is somewhat believable, the taste is not like places in New Mexico specifically Albuquerque (Los Cuates, Sadies, El Patio, El Pinto, The Range) which are fantastic. BUT this place will serve as my green chile fix while here in San Francisco. I do love their green chile chicken blue corn enchiladas. Enjoy just understand, it is New Mexican inspired food. I will continue to have my family ship me my green chile.
author: julie q.

description: This place is great! Great fresh food, excellent mexican beer prices. The only reason that it did not get 5 stars is that in can be packed with tons of toddlers running around. It's best to go for a late dinner when they're sound asleep.
author: Matthew M.

description: Awesome to have the luxury of authentic New Mexican cuisine in city.
author: tureg u.

description: We were so excited when they finally opened, and we went there a few times. The burritos are pretty great, made with high quality ingredients. The trouble is that we got tired of them really quickly, as the quality tended to diminish every time we went. The first couple weeks, the owners were very kind and offered great service, but as they hired more staff, the service got worse. Not to mention that the price is way too much for what you get. $2-$3 bottled sodas? Not even some fancy restaurants charge that much. Needless to say, we don't go here much anymore.
author: Charlie K.

description: I've had to modify my review because the last several times I've gone here I've been completely disappointed.  The service has been awful and the food just so-so.  I'm not returning and it's too bad because this place used to be really great!
author: J D.

description: Their chicken is just so succulent it makes everything wonderful, and the Chile is on point. Its a great corner spot!  I'm happy to have it in the neighborhood! They are also always making improvement such as outdoor seating and new menu items that keep me walking down the hill for it.
author: Megan B.

description:
A discovery made in 2007 while on a stroll.   After multiple attempts to spend more than $27 for 2 persons (including alcohol),  the BF and I simply show up at least once a week and have stopped questioning the bill.

Its cheap, and good.  Served on real plates with actual silverware, everything comes to you fresh and warm.   The green chile stew will blast out a cold, and we've nicknamed the homemade chicken enchilada plate "legal crack."    Breakfasts are equally pleasant.
author: M M.

description:
Cheap and amazing!
Have you noticed that there a million taquerias in SF but very few sit down Mexican restaurants?  When you want a taqueria (i.e., super cheap, slightly dodgy, super authentic sloppy food), you're set.  If you want a sit down meal with high quality ingredients, harder to find.  Green Chile Kitchen met that goal for me -- $30 for 2 entrees and chips and a sampler of salsas and 2 sodas.  More expensive than a taqueria, of course, but way cheap compared to most restaurants in the city.  I LOVE Southwestern food and we don't have much of it here.  The quality of the chicken, pork, and steak is fantastic and the green chile sauces are spicy and delicious!
author: Kristi S.

description: visited this place last night and had a really good and cheap meal.  I had the vegetarian burrito with tufo and guacamole (these cost extra) and a ginseng cream soda.   they have a fantastic green chile sauce, which is flavorful and hot, but not too overpowering.  they also had a really interesting salsa that i could not stop eating.  the owner/manager was chill and talked to us for a bit about how they get their chiles from New Mexico and how the restaurant was started as a group of people who just really loved cooking & eating these unique green chiles from New Mexico.
author: sam h.

description: Love it. Best quesadilla I have had in awhile.   And it did not have that greesy nasty food hangover that happens after mexican food.  I am not a five starer type of person but truely believe from my one experience that this is a five star joint.
author: Jacqueline B.

description:
two stars for the fact that the lady barely put green sauce on my burrito and wanted to charge 2 dollars for a small container of green sauce.
the prices are high and to try and charge for more of the main ingredient of their little establishment.
bullshit.
author: santiago c.

description: I had the Green Chile Stew, and it was delicious! Big chunks of Niman Ranch Pork, with potatoes, and green chilies. It also had tomatoes, but they didn't over power the flavor. (I'm not a big tomato person) There was a kick, but you could still taste after it was over. The staff was super friendly and helpful. They are a new restaurant, and probably still working out the kinks, but they are doing super well. I hope they last longer than the other burrito joint that was in the neighborhood, although they are more than a burrito joint!! I recommend it highly!
author: Lori F.

description: Just had breakfast at Green Chile Kitchen. I was hoping for more selections on the breakfast menu - they only have one - but I'm told New Mexican food doesn't really do breakfast. Anyways, the only breakfast item, a breakfast burrito was excellent. I highly recommend it if you're in the mood for one. It's a bit pricey for a burrito, ($5.95, +$1.95 for bacon, steak or chicken) but the food is organic and meat is top notch. The restaurant itself is open and airy, very comfortable.  I'll defiantly return to try dinner and the next time I'm craving a healthy breakfast burrito.
author: Michael A.

description:
i dont understand why its hard to find a burito in this hood. but now we have 2 place. both good. i really like this place. its nice, they are nice, the food is nice. nice. 

i like the buritos. the salsas are good. they even have tasty little cakes and deserts. its good...check it out.
author: kelly M.

description: I take people here all the time, and everyone loves it. The food is good, the prices are fair, and the atmosphere is comfortable. What else can you ask for?
author: Mojo L.

description:
man in my book , the burrito was horrible, sloppy tasteless and the taco, i could have made at home..
walking to the mission is a safer bet or  up the street to papalotes.....
author: patrick blap S.

description: The green chile is good. The red chile is excellent. However, how can this place be called New Mexican cuisine when they don't serve sopapillas? There was a rumour that they'd have them at the new location, but still no sopapillas. Docked a star.
author: Anna Mae W.

description: I am a student in Berkeley and rarely have time to make the trip into the city (although I should much more often), but every time I do I eat at Green Chile.  I have literally gone into the city just to eat there, turn around and go home.  I enjoy the atmosphere, the crowd (which includes families, young hip San Franciscans, and everything in between), and of course, THE FOOD! I have never ordered anything I did not love: the soups, tacos, quesadillas, and my favorite: the burritos.  I am a vegetarian and love the fact that I can add tofu to my burritos for some extra protein and it also adds plenty of flavor.  The grilled veggie burrito is my favorite meal.  I add hot green chiles to anything I order, and I could literally eat it with a spoon.  I am a huge fan, and if you want a real treat the breakfast burritos are delicious!
author: Kit D.

description:
breakfast burrito w/ bacon and fluffy eggs.  seven days a week.  

great way to start the day!
author: Chris G.

description:
The food is good, but my problem is that I think I don't understand Tex-Mex. I think T.M. tries to be Mexican, but it's just not there. I'd rather hit up a good Taqueria any day, but I live close by and have tried this place a couple of times. 

I don't like the fact that you have to pay extra for one of their sauces. My opinion of Mexican-related food is that salsa MAKES it what it is. I don't think one should have to pay extra for one of their sauces, it should be standard for them to include it. 

Also, portions aren't that big. Food is good, and it's very fresh. Just a couple of things I'd like to see different to get a higher Yelp from me.
author: Eric D.

description:
this place has the best roasted chicken and the price is less than if you bought one at a market.  you can get it in your burrito or just the chicken.
when my kitty is being extra finiky he says, "GREEN CHILE chicken please!"  he gets the quarter chicken and i get a burrito.  everyone is happy!
author: misskim f.

description: Someone else said it best... "mexican food for people who don't like mexican food", or something like that. The ambiance is nice though, and the food isn't bad so 3 stars for me.
author: Brian W.

description: Worst nachos I've ever had.  The dish was overcooked causing the chips to be chewy and cheese nearly burnt.  For $10.95, I've had much better.
author: Melissa G.

description: EDIT: I have to take away a couple stars since they moved to their new location. The service has taken a steep decline. I've never seen a place get orders wrong as much as they do. I don't think I'll be going back there as there are so many other Mexican food options within walking distance.
author: Brent S.

description: First time here on Saturday April 24 and was impressed.  I like the semi-upscaled concept Mexican restaurants, but ones that stick to basics and to Mexican roots.  My partner and I both had a 3 soft taco plate, with 1 each Chicken, pork & steak.  Very good.  What really impressed me was the abundant guac with chips.  Usually the ratio of chip to guac at most restaurants is on the chip side.  But here, they are very generous with the guac!
author: Joel M.

description: Won't go back!  The food is fine, but the service (and I mean especially the taller, woman who works the cash machine) is INEPT and RUDE.  Not only did she give us the wrong take out order, which left the two vegetarians at home with nothing to eat, but she also had the audacity to cop an attitude and act real rude when I pointed out her mistake.   In this economy and in this city where there is no dirth of tasty mexican eateries, poor customer service is a pretty darn good way to ensure your failure. Green Chile is doing itself a huge disservice by not hiring better staff.  Listen up!
author: ranjani r.

description: A gazillion times better than Tango 20, but that's not saying much -- Tango 20 was a laughably embarrassing excuse for a "burrito" joint.  At Green Chile, we had a couple of burritos -- one beef, one chicken -- and they were great.  We don't need massive burritos -- just good fresh and yummy burritos.  These were just that.  We'll still go to our usual haunt, Zona Rosa, but thank god Green Chile came along -- I thought the NoPa neighborhood was jinxed for a really good burrito place.  I was wrong.   Good soup too -- spicy and savory.  Being able to buy vino there is also a big plus (not everyone likes beer).  We'll definitely go there again -- SOON!  :)
author: katie b.

description:
i LOVE this place. i can't say how much i love it. no words can do it justice, really.

new mexican/mexican, i really could care less about that. i love that they use organic chicken and beef! 

getting the 1/4 chicken meal with salad and tortillas and salsa for $8?? are you kidding me, that's a steal. i love that i can get a healthy and reasonable meal for lunch here that tastes SO good.
author: Katy P.

description:
The food is good. The owner is snide. I ate there once. There were two of us and together we paid 27 buckaroos for two breakfast burritos and two coffees and an orange juice. What a rip. The real ripoff is when they add "Christmas sauce," and then they add that for a nice little upgrade price. When  I ate there, the owner asked me how everything was.  I told him I thought it was too expensive, but he said that he has to pay to fly in the green chile's from New Mexico and they have to buy the Niman ranch bacon, etc.  The chiles tasted freeze dried and the Niman Ranch bacon was barely even used in the burrito and kind of burnt. The food was tasty (despite the lack of bacon) but the price is really lame. If I wanted to pay through the nose and act like a yuppie, I would go to the NOPA where it's at least gourmet. 

Otherwise, it's Papalote's for me.

I hate stingy ripoff whitewashed burrito places.  It really chaps my hide.
author: Wild G.

description: This is a neighborhood joint for me, so the fact I can walk there in 10 minutes makes it high on my list.  The food is great for the price and the menu offers a nice selection including vegetarian!  I love New Mexico and every time I go to this place I feel as if I'm back in Taos.  I would definitely recommend greenchilekitchen to those in the neighborhood looking for a nice relaxing easy cheap meal.
author: megan f.

description:
"Green Chile is awesome.  I found this place by mistake one day.  The atmosphere is great. The staff are all pretty darn cool and the food is consistently good.  If you want a recommendation - try the green chile stew with a piece of cornbread.  

Great place for lunch or dinner."
author: W S.

description:
Love this place! The free sampling of nachos and salsa is the perfect size and yummy. I usually order a burrito (naked) with Nieman Ranch steak. I'm never disappointed. 
I think it's reasonably priced for the quality and freshness of the food.
author: kathleen f.

description: After 3 years of patronage I've had it with the new smaller and more expensive burritos since the move to the new location - and don't deny it GCK - "super" burrito serving sizes are consistently around 75% of the good old days.  I've kept going back hoping it will change, but no diced chili.  $9.30 for a burrito that leaves me hungry is really frustrating and I feel like somebody is smoking a cigar in the back room, counting my money and chuckling to themselves.  No mas.  Plenty of other burrito choices in walking distance.
author: hyvjhbgjuyhgjuhb i.

description: Wow, this place is delicious and relatively inexpensive.  The food is absolutely delicious.  Perfect for a casual dinner out with some friends.  Seating is a little tight, but overall a great place.  Heard they have a good brunch.
author: Tyler S.

description: Great Mexican restaurant with intimate/authentic flavor and feel.  Warm and partially lit atmosphere with nice furniture,and open layout.  My favorite mexican dish is tamales and the homemade tamales at Green Chile Kitchen were excellent.  Smaller portions, great taste and very filling.
author: William M.

description: Update, I ordered food to go and if you are from New Mexico you know this is not what they serve in New Mexico. Don't get me wrong it was good but not what I'm use to. It is a yuppie version of Mew Mexico food, so for the area with no street parking it is still worth a visit. The posole was good and spicy with the red chile. If you order the red chile it is spicy but it was made with no-meat vegetarian red chile? this is strange...In New Mexico we eat burritos with fried pork meat (so good). The green chile is ok, it has spices that I have never tasted before.
author: Debra V.

description: In from out of town and out to dinner with friends.  Great place for tacos in the neighborhood.  I hear it does get a bit crowded sometimes, but definitely worth your time.  I had two beef tacos with beans and rice.   Normally, I never really notice the beans and rice on my plate, but this time the rice got my attention.  Huge fan of the rice!   Perfect amount of food with a very reasonable price tag.  Also, really enjoyed the free water bar.  Being from the south, I love drinking out of a mason jar.  Im such a bumpkin.
author: Tony K.

description: i may be biased because i live close by, but everything has been delicious.  i highly recommend the calabacitas quesadilla and the flat enchiladas.
author: Michelle B.

description: Great place.   Service could be a little better, but the quality of the food and flavors are outstanding
author: Nat S.

description: good mexican influenced food.  they are quick, efficient and consistent. Also, they are my neighbors and alway there when I need a beef taco to wash away the hangover.  I highly recommend the chicken soup!
author: Hilary P.

description:
This one is for Tim....
Nice atmosphere in a sf hipster hood but an experience I could have done without.  I had heard a lot about Green Chile and was really looking forward to trying it, especially given my deeply rooted Texas taste buds.   I was so excited that I finally found myself in the area on a Saturday afternoon that I decided to overlook the un-cleaned tables to try it out for brunch.  
I ordered the breakfast tacos with chorizo and my companion ordered the regular tamale plate.  The tacos were nothing to write home about.  I could of made the same thing at home with a short trip to the mission o for the chorizo.  In fact, I didn't even need to make that trip to the mission because the sausage on my plate didn't resemble chorizo at all as it was so darn bland.  Definitely, not worth the fat or calories.  The tacos had a small dollop of pico but was absent of any real salsa and avocado, which I find offensive.
The offense became even stronger as my companion kept eating his tamales looking for the meat.  I have never in my life ever seen such a small amount of meat in tamale before.  It had to be less than one once (not an exaggeration).  I've eaten tamales throughout central and have never seen such a thing so I'm not sure where Green Chile's inspiration is coming from, other than trying to maximize profits.  They should just label it as masa.  Oh, and that brings me to another point.  This lovely meal without drinks or apps totaled 24 bucks.  Really? 
I firmly believe that this place is popular only because there are not all that many places to frequent nearby.  So my word of advice to all the hipsters keeping this place afloat.....get on the Muni and expand your horizons.
author: Maria R.

description: Yummy vegetarian green chili stew with fresh tortillas.
author: Lucy G.

description: I absolutely LOVE Green Chile Kitchen. I eat there at least twice a week. Their food tastes great, is reasonable, and I love that their take out containers are compostable. The ambiance in the restaurant is also really nice. :)
author: Kell E.

description: This place is beyond good (especially the organic chicken) and I'm seriously in danger since I live only 2 blocks away and can't stop going there. I may need an intervention. Seriously.
author: C W.

description: when you're craving spice and carbs a la mexicana nueva, this is it. do not go anywhere else. do not pass go. do not collect $200. instead, get a burrito (x-mas style) and some green chile mashed potatoes, and curl up with a good book. or sit at a table and just breath in the organic freshness. ah.
author: Bee H.

description: ok burritos (still beter than tango 20's), but yummy roast chicken. another great addition to the panhandle. i'll never buy a roasted albertsons chicken again!
author: desi d.

description: delicious, clean, and cheap (new) mexican!
author: Cass M.

description: Very good food.  Vegetarian options. Authentic taste
author: JB B.

description: I love this place.  For what it is - quick, healthy, flavorful food - it's the best.  I've had some three star meals and some five star (a sublime burrito last week) so I'll settle on four, but the vast majority of the time I"ve left very content (if a little too full....)
author: Margaret L.

description: Neighborhood gem but worth a trip across town for a New Mexico  twist on Mexican food.  Fresh as it gets.  Great chicken - burrito especially.  Great soup.  Good drink selection.  I am very glad it has moved up the hill a block to the much larger location.  It has always been very kid & group friendly but the old location was too small to get consistant seating (and wrangle the rug rats).  Check it out.
author: E. Z.

description: Delicious. And pretty cheap. And they offer drive-up pickup. Good veggie options too.
author: Andrea M.

description: Feeling a little homesick, I did a little Google-ing for "reminds me of Dos Coyotes" to see if I could find a replacement for one of my favorite places back home. I was surprised that my search actually yielded some usable results including a place in Cupertino that I plan to try next week. GCK also came up and I decided to hop on a 24 over to W.A. to try them on for size. Tonight was an experiment, trying to take in several flavors at once so that I could form a good opinion of the place -- unfortunately this meant I ordered a few things that I ended up really hating, but I also found a few things that were really freaking delicious -- hence the 3-star review. I imagine that with some fine-tuning (on my part, not theirs) that I will find an amazing selection that fits my particular tastes, the menu certainly looked tasty. I really hated Dos Coyotes the first few times that I ordered from there, but it eventually became one of my favorite places, which is why I am so optimistic that I will find the right combination on GCK's menu with time.
author: Wayne F.

description: updated menu and expanded hours both make the place even better. and they've got yerba mate, too. a+
author: Sidney B.

description: with the exception of some under done, over cheesed chicken enchiladas, this place is fantastic. so far I've tried 5 different items and they have all been delicious. they are always super nice about replacing beans with extra salad. friends and i come about twice a month and sometimes twice in a week. the salsas are totally addicting! its the kind of food you never want to end! $2 pacificos= win.
author: Jessica H.

description: when not doing the papalote thang, i come here - wider menu with tamales, tacos y burritos and a really good breakfast menu.  christmas salsa?  yes please!
author: Ken L.

description: oh my goodness, yes!  YES!!!  Ok, so I used to live in New Mexico, and I still have an aunt there who (whom?) I visit every year or two.  Whenever I go back to NM I hit up an authentic New Mexican restaurant (try Jalisco if you happen to be in Silver City) and order a burrito with green chile and sopapillas.  One of the biggest New Mexican red and green chile distributors is a company called Bueno, and would you believe it, the Green Chile Kitchen serves Bueno.  It's actually not a small task to get Bueno chile shipped out here to California, so props to GCK.  My mom brings back a suitcase full of frozen containers of chile whenever she visits my aunt, and that's actually how GCK started.  Just a group of friends that likes Bueno chile and brings home a suitcase full whenever they travel back from NM.  The green chile stew is yummmy!-- I had mine with pork.  The veggie burrito is also bumpin' (I addend tofu, cheese, and da bomb guacamole.)  The salsa sampler is also very good.  Seriously, do yourself a favor and check it out.  It's not your run of the mill Mexican joint.  It's has a NEW Mexican twist, and there's a difference ;-)
author: Christina M.

description: Loved this place. Tasty food, very affordable prices and comfy casual atmosphere. It's a gem of a restaurant.
author: melissa l.

description: Good burrito's if you want an Americanized burrito.  They use Niman Ranch steak so the meat is very good, and the green chilli stew is quite good as well.  Other than that it's just not mexican food.
author: L M K M.

description: awesome food. green chile stew is my fave.
author: Missy D.

description: I keep going back to this place, too, finding the chicken in particular extremely tasty. It is a bit pricey, but not too bad and, as another reviewer noted, as they use free-range and organic meats and produce, it's really worth it. I don't eat beef but my g/f does and swears that the Niman Ranch steak for the burrito is also really good. Each time I've been in I've found the service - particularly if you get/talk to one of the managers (owners?) - friendly and positive. They give you some blue corn chips and salsa with each burrito, too. The soda offerings are nice - organic and/or gourmet - along with some wine selections. The only other food I've tried is the salad, for which you get to choose the items that go in, all organic and really good. It was also a little overpriced for what you get, I'd say. The pozole was quite good; not the best I've ever had but good. I've heard their stews are also nice, and, once again, the fresh, free range chicken is tasty. All in all, not perfect, but definitely better than your average taqueria and better (and also more expensive) than the new, chain-ish  Papalote taqueria up the street (which isn't bad either).
author: Craigary P.

description: not bad. good prices in the neighborhood but don't go out of your way for it.  $2 tecate all day everyday is a good draw
author: Tim T.

description: I just came across Green Chile Kitchen and was so excited to try it because I spent a few months in New Mexico and miss the food so much! It definitely surpassed my expectations.  I was surprised that it was more of a cafe than a restaurant but ended up really liking the casual atmosphere, made it much more neighborhoody.  The food was SO GOOD-- I had the posole which was so deep and flavorful and a side salad (even the chipotle lime dressing was yummy).  My dining buddy had the green chile stew, which was also just really rich and flavorful and yummy.  We were even impressed with the habanero salsa and a side of guac.  I can't wait to go back for brunch to try the breakfast burrito and am definitely making this a regular pit stop.
author: Alissa A.

description: If you think you've known burritoes in San Francisco and the best...Think again!!!  Welcome to Green Chile Kitchen a recent addition to maybe the Best Of All Burritoes in Town..they make Godawwsomely Gourmet New Mexican cuisine..guaranteed fresh..yummy and all organic!!  Great selection of organic wines (love the Malbec), delicious dips..and cozy ambience complete this kitchen.  Try it once..you'll neva lose it :)
author: Purvi S.

description: damn gina this place rocks!!! today was the first time in about 2 years  i have been here .... it was brand new the last time i went .... i was sad when my favorite burrito place in the Castro closed ... i was saddened that i would never find a GOOD cheap burrito place .... today i was out shopping with the partner and decided that we would have a burrito and drink ... drove by this place and BAM! it was open ... so we ate there .... we both had the veggie burrito with all the fixin's and i had can o soda and he had beer ($21 total)... DAMN GINA was it good! i now have a NEW  favorite place and it is just down the street from the homestead .... that veggie burrito with all the fixin's made my belly full!  fantastico!
author: Sean B.

description: Great food!!! Love it. However only 4 stars because i ordered a veggie quesadilla and instead of potato, maybe they were out, they put in zucchini. Thats not a substitute for potato.
author: a b.

description: 2 words....BREAKFAST BURRITO....Holy shite..... fluffy scrambeld eggs, roasted potatoes, green chili sauce, well cooked bacon (not the fatty uncooked stuff you'll find in most bfast burreets) and some cheese.  A little pricy at 8 clams but well worth it.  This place also has $2 pacifico's all day long .   yeeeeee-ahhhh
author: Mike Honcho H.

description: Awesome chicken burritos with the green chili sauce! Friendly staff! I am sad that I moved out of this neighborhood right before they opened - this is a perfect addition to the neighborhood!
author: CC C.

description: Completely overated.  We picked this place based on the other 33 reviews and because it was close to our place.  The food was completely bland, including the green chile-rubbed roasted chicken, the simmered pork plate and the sides.  No spicyness at all.  We got takeout on a Friday night during dinner time.  There was not a single person eating dinner there!  I should have taken the hint!  Save your money for places with more flavor and that have actual people eating there.
author: Maria D.

description: Truly Delicious!: A tasty, fresh meal in burrito form. This is no taqueria. (Other reviewers favor the taqueria for its size. I say that's a silly and crass way to rate food quality.)
author: Bradley S.

description: no, it's not authentic mexican.  yes, it is delicious.  seriously, everything at this place is really really tasty.  the rotisserie chicken is delicious, and a total deal, the burritos and other "mexican" food is good (as long as you're not a stickler for authenticity), and their salads are delicious.  breakfast, lunch or dinner, this is a cute place to pop in for a bite.  the food is fresh and the prices are reasonable.  if you're in the area, it's worth checking out.
author: Amy L.

description: I love this place! It's a great neighborhood restaurant to hit when you're tired of the usual suspects -- Thai, burgers, pizza... etc. I tend to call head and pick up food rather than hanging out there because it's usually busy. The menu is conveniently posted on their website. I especially enjoy the make-your-own-salad option.
author: Kris D.

description: my boyfriend used to live around block from this restaurant and we would go almost every week. although that's no longer the case, we still make it back whenever we can. the restaurant itself is clean and cozy inside, albeit crowded at times. the food is terrific- especially considering the price point. the vegetarian nachos are amazing! big enough to share and so delicious! all of the breakfast items are good, but usually have slightly smaller portions. even the coffee is excellent! extra points for using many organic and sustainable ingredients, and for serving everything on heath ceramics.
author: hannah c.

description:
ive been constantly disappointed with the food as well as the service.

because this location is hyper local, meaning its steps from my front door, it has convenience but that goes out the window because the food is gross.
on two different occasions, my order was incomplete, lacking the ingredients that were claimed to be in the food .... the ingredients called for potatoes, and all i got was zucchini and squash. i voiced my concerned.
i ordered a breakfast burrito out of a hangover desperation.... ingredients called for bacon... i didnt get bacon in my very expensive breakfast burrito. 
over all, the food is not appealing, perhaps its the legacy of the location itself. also more importantly to myself,. the place is so lilly washed and lacks any type of diversity what-so-ever. and the service people seem to treat other brown people very particular. 
so whats more of a turn off, the food or the service... well both. and for me... thats all it takes. i will continue to walk past this place with no desire to support my hyper local businesses. i will stand waiting for the bus as if this place never existed, because i can only be fooled for so long before i realize its not me... its them!!!
yuck, thumbs down.
author: tiffany h.

description: food is very good but the service is scattered and everyone from the kitchen to the front person is unbearably slow
author: Noe K.
